data.question: What is the space group of the chiral adduct formed by compound 1 and Cd(NO3)2·4H2O?
What is the coordination geometry around the metal ion in adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH?
data.answer: Hexacoordinated with two pyrimidine ligands (equatorial cis), water and ethanol (equatorial cis), and two nitrate ions (axial trans).

data.question: How is the chirality in adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH preserved?
data.answer: Via homochiral interstrand water−nitrate hydrogen bonding.

data.question: Can adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH exhibit circular dichroism?
data.answer: Yes, it exhibits circular dichroism with an exciton-coupled split Cotton effect.

data.question: Is the crystallization of adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH always homochiral?
data.answer: No, it is homochiral if not always.

data.question: What happens to the chirality of adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH upon crystallization?
data.answer: It affords an enantiomerically pure chiral coordination polymer.

data.question: Can the chirality of homochiral crystals of adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH be controlled?
data.answer: Yes, by seeding with preformed P-2 or M-2.

data.question: Is adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·3H2O chiral?
data.answer: No, it forms an achiral trihydrate adduct.

data.question: What is the structure of the pyrimidine−Cd2+ coordination in adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·3H2O?
data.answer: Nonhelical pyrimidine−Cd2+ zigzag chains.

data.question: Does adduct 1·Co(NO3)2·2EtOH form helical chains?
data.answer: Yes, it forms helical chains.

data.question: What is the role of ethanol in the structure of adduct 1·Co(NO3)2·2EtOH?
data.answer: It stabilizes the helix via intrastrand ethanol−nitrate hydrogen bonding.

data.question: Can the chirality of adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH be retained after ligand exchange?
data.answer: Yes, the chirality (helicity) is retained after ligand-induced chiral−achiral−chiral transformation.

data.question: Is it possible to induce homochiral helix winding in achiral adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·3H2O?
data.answer: Yes, by seeding with a small amount of P-2 or M-2.

data.question: Does adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH lose chirality upon conversion to adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·3H2O?
data.answer: Yes, it loses chirality and becomes CD-silent.

data.question: Can achiral adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·3H2O be converted into a racemic form of adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH?
data.answer: Yes, but without net chirality.

data.question: Is the conversion of achiral adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·3H2O to adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH a memory effect?
data.answer: Yes, it represents a kind of memory of chirality.

data.question: What is the pitch height of the helical array in adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH?
What is the intersheet distance in the 3D structure composed of alternating chiral chromophoric and helical metal−organic layers?
Does the presence of ethanol affect the chirality of the adduct formed by compound 1 and Cd(NO3)2·4H2O?
data.answer: Yes, the presence of ethanol leads to the formation of a chiral adduct.

data.question: Is the helix winding associated with the conversion of adduct 1·Cd(NO3)2·3H2O to 1·Cd(NO3)2·H2O·EtOH reversible?
data.answer: Yes, it is reversible and can be controlled by seeding.
